column4: I want to compile something and have met most of the dependencies by installing various -dev packages. however, I have no idea what to do to get around this error message from ./configure: "configure: error: X development libraries not found". which package do I install?
another option is x-window-system-dev
some weirder packages require specialized x -dev stuff; if that still doesn't work, put config.log up on the pastebin and maybe we can guess at other -dev packages
thoreauputic x-window-system-dev is already installed as well
what app is this?
thoreauputic I am trying to compile rox-session, as the injected version seems to need a slightly older dbus-glib-1 than I have here. the precompiled packages are way too old
that config.log is a bit empty... ?
indeed it is
isn't there a config.log in the higher level dir
i.e., where you ran 'AppRun' from
sadly there is not, but I'll try and see if mplayer's configure spits out more useful information regarding missing x
puzzling. maybe 'find -iname config.log' ?
maybe I messed up something... I'll try a few things, then I'll completely reinstall all the x-related packages
on http://paste.ubuntulinux.nl there is a python script to do uploads
hmm
i have an X.h
it's part of x11proto-core-dev
but i'm sure it should be installed via x-window-system-dev
note that x-window-system-core and x-window-system-dev are two different packages
I willing to admit I messed it all up myself. I'll purge and reinstall all those packages
x11proto-core-dev *is* a dependency of x-windows-system-dev, via libx11-dev

fyi I solved it by purging x-windows-whatever-dev and all the packages it depends on, then I purged all the packages that depended on it. then I reinstalled that x-window-whatever-dev and an now happily ./configure my stuff.
